BBEX3.A.STD.USD.CA.AA.A04: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Sao Tome and Principe / USD 1 = STD ... (buying)
General: The unit of account for 1,000 dobras is 1 conto.
Source: Since November 1993 Banco Central de São Tomé e Príncipe, São Tomé1978 - October 1993 Banco Central de São Tomé e Príncipe, São Tomé
Methodology: Calculated on the basis of month-end rates.

Comment on 1987: On 22 July 1987, the dobra was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate): 21 July 1987 USD 1 = STD 36.1385 / 38.3739 22 July 1987 USD 1 = STD 75.8825 / 80.5763. Calculated using this exchange rates the dobra was devalued against the US dollar by 52.4%.

Comment on 1988: On 22 July 1988, the dobra was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate): 21 July 1988 USD 1 = STD 79.3480 / 81.7640 22 July 1988 USD 1 = STD 98.5040 / 101.5040. Calculated using this exchange rates the dobra was devalued against the US dollar by 19.4%.

Comment on 1989: On 13 February 1989, the dobra was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate): 10 February 1989 USD 1 = STD 99.1940 / 102.2160 13 February 1989 USD 1 = STD 118.2010 / 121.8010. Calculated using this exchange rates the dobra was devalued against the US dollar by 16.1%.

Comment on 1991: On 16 May 1991, the dobra was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate): 15 May 1991 USD 1 = STD 150.5180 / 155.1020 16 May 1991 USD 1 = STD 185.1540 / 188.8940. Calculated using this exchange rates the dobra was devalued against the US dollar by 18.3% (middle rate). On 2 September 1991, the dobra was devalued again. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate): 31 August 1991 USD 1 = STD 182.5520 / 186.2400 2 September 1991 USD 1 = STD 257.4100 / 262.6100. Calculated using this exchange rates the dobra was devalued against the US dollar by 29.1%.
